summary: A collection of sanity‑test utilities that scan the Ansible codebase for various code‑smell issues and repository hygiene problems, such as deprecated configuration settings, prohibited Unicode characters, disallowed files, obsolete directories, missing package data, markdown linting failures, release‑name mismatches, and outdated bundled dependencies, alongside some unused placeholder scripts.
business_intent: Maintain high code quality and compliance with Ansible project standards by automatically detecting and preventing configuration errors, unwanted content, structural inconsistencies, packaging omissions, documentation problems, and outdated third‑party components during sanity testing.
